data.title: “Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven’t found it yet, keep looking. Don’t settle. As with all matters of the heart, you’ll know when you find it.

We need to accept that we won’t always make the right decisions, that we’ll screw up royally sometimes – understanding that failure is not the opposite of success, it’s part of success.” – Arianna Huffington
“When written in Chinese the word “crisis” is composed of two characters – one represents danger and the other represents opportunity.”
“Sometimes when you’re in a dark place you think you’ve been buried but you’ve actually been planted.”

We need to accept that we won’t always make the right decisions, that we’ll screw up royally sometimes – understanding that failure is not the opposite of success, it’s part of success.” – Arianna Huffington
“I now tried a new hypothesis: It was possible that I was more in charge of my happiness than I was allowing myself to be.”
“You can waste your lives drawing lines. Or you can live your life crossing them.”

remainder.title: “Work like there is someone working twenty four hours a day to take it away from you.”
“I now tried a new hypothesis: It was possible that I was more in charge of my happiness than I was allowing myself to be.”

“Don’t say you don’t have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo Da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, and Albert Einstein.”
“Never stop doing your best just because someone doesn’t give you credit.”
“If you hear a voice within you say ‘you cannot paint,’ then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced.”
“You can waste your lives drawing lines. Or you can live your life crossing them.”

trashes.title: Smart people learn from everything and everyone, average people from their experiences, stupid people already have all the answers.” – Socrates
Whatever you are, be a good one.” ― Abraham Lincoln
Write it. Shoot it. Publish it. Crochet it, sauté it, whatever. MAKE.” – Joss Whedon
“The miracle is not that we do this work, but that we are happy to do it.”

archives.title: “If you’re offered a seat on a rocket ship, don’t ask what seat! Just get on.”
“Great things are done by a series of small things brought together”
